snippet: In August 2010, as my husband and I approached our 50th birthdays, we were suddenly forced to move into my parents’ home in Michigan with our three teenage children and dog.
abstract: Jennifer Colin article on being forced for economic reasons to move with her husband and children into her parents' home in Michigan; domestic arrangement, which was supposed to be temporary, has ended up becoming an unexpected test case of multi-generational living that they now have grown to accept; she notes that the federal census bureau reported that shared households accounted for 18.7 percent of all American households in 2010.
lead_paragraph: In August 2010, as my husband and I approached our 50th birthdays, we were suddenly forced to move into my parents’ home in Michigan with our three teenage children and dog.
